title: Self-Attention Amortized Distributional Projection Optimization for Sliced Wasserstein Point-Cloud Reconstruction. (arXiv:2301.04791v2 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
abstract: Max sliced Wasserstein (Max-SW) distance has been widely known as a solution for less discriminative projections of sliced Wasserstein (SW) distance. In applications that have various independent pairs of probability measures, amortized projection optimization is utilized to predict the ``max" projecting directions given two input measures instead of using projected gradient ascent multiple times. Despite being efficient, Max-SW and its amortized version cannot guarantee metricity property due to the sub-optimality of the projected gradient ascent and the amortization gap. Therefore, we propose to replace Max-SW with distributional sliced Wasserstein distance with von Mises-Fisher (vMF) projecting distribution (v-DSW). Since v-DSW is a metric with any non-degenerate vMF distribution, its amortized version can guarantee the metricity when performing amortization. translated_abstract: 最大切片Wasserstein（Max-SW）距离以其对切片Wasserstein（SW）距离的不够区分的投影的解决方案而广为人知。在具有各种独立概率测度对的应用中，使用分摊投影优化来预测“max”投影方向，而不是多次使用投影梯度上升。尽管Max-SW及其分摊版本高效，但由于投影梯度上升的子优化性和分摊间隔，无法保证度量性质。因此，我们建议用带有von Mises-Fisher（vMF）投影分布（v-DSW）的分布切片Wasserstein距离替换Max-SW。由于v-DSW是具有任何非退化vMF分布的度量，因此它的分摊版本可以保证在执行分摊时进行度量。此外，当前的分摊模型不具有置换不变性和对称性。为解决这个问题，我们设计了分摊模型，使其在对称和置换不变性方面都能保证度量性。
tldr: 提出v-DSW来代替Max-SW，保证投影优化的度量性，设计具有置换不变性和对称性的分摊模型，可应用于切片Wasserstein点云重建。
en_tdlr: The paper proposes using v-DSW replacing Max-SW to guarantee the metricity of projection optimization, designs an amortized model with permutation invariance and symmetry, which could be applied to sliced Wasserstein point-cloud reconstruction.
